identified-content.classifier: Top/News/Sports/Pro Football/National Football League/New York Jets
Top/News/Sports/Pro Football/National Football League/Tampa Bay Buccaneers

abstract.p: New York Jets victory over Tampa Bay Buccanerrs discussed (M)

block.p: The Jets scooped up receiver Vincent Brisby hours after the Patriots released him during training camp, hoping that Brisby would eventually become a starter.
Instead, Brisby has been virtually invisible while the diminutive Dedric Ward, inserted into the starting lineup opposite Wayne Chrebet, has risen to the occasion.
The Jets scooped up receiver Vincent Brisby hours after the Patriots released him during training camp, hoping that Brisby would eventually become a starter.
Instead, Brisby has been virtually invisible while the diminutive Dedric Ward, inserted into the starting lineup opposite Wayne Chrebet, has risen to the occasion.
Today, the Jets put Brisby, a tall receiver in the mold of Keyshawn Johnson, on the inactive list for the game.

Ward has 13 receptions for 262 yards in the first four games, with critical receptions in fourth-quarter scoring drives against Green Bay (a 61-yarder) and New England (44 yards). Brisby has 4 receptions for 60 yards.
Dwight Stone, the kick-return specialist who was re-signed by the Jets this week, also was inactive. Laveranues Coles and Kevin Williams continued to return kicks.
The other inactive players were: quarterback Chad Pennington, linebacker Courtney Ledyard, tackle Chad Slaughter, defensive tackle Maurice Anderson and defensive end Dorian Boose.

Receiver Laveranues Coles and tight end Anthony Becht made their first professional catches in the first half. Coles caught a 17-yard pass on third-and-9 from Vinny Testaverde, who was under a heavy blitz. Coles's reception gave the Jets first-and-10 on the Tampa Bay 27-yard line. John Hall kicked a 41-yard field goal to complete the drive. Coles had another catch in the second quarter. Becht's reception, a 5-yarder, came on the first play of the second-quarter drive that led to Hall's second field goal. Becht finished with two catches for 20 yards and Coles had two for 34.

Aaron Glenn intercepted Tampa Bay quarterback Shaun King on a pass intended for Keyshawn Johnson early in the third quarter. It was the Jets' second interception of King and just the second he has thrown all year.
''They wanted a war, we gave them a war,'' Glenn said. ''You all thought they were a better team.''
